title: len(string) counts trailing NULLs
body:
http://play.golang.org/p/jtB23uPQWB

Coming from C, this threw me off. Even if the built-in len() function can't be updated
to handle this, it'd be nice if TrimSpace() or something did.

What is the expected output?
10 [104 101 108 108 111 0 0 0 0 0]
5 hello

What do you see instead?
10 [104 101 108 108 111 0 0 0 0 0]
10 hello

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
Whatever is default on 64-bit Windows 7

Which operating system are you using?
Windows 7

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
1.0.3
